2d68e16d-c2dc-40c9-9172-87a254477925: A blue-white ray of freezing air and ice springs from your hand. You must succeed on a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} with the ray to deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to a target. The ray deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 25d6) and 1d4 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} drain.
534accca-794a-481c-8685-c5c417d5e47e:
A brilliant divine radiance surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by evil creatures, and causing evil creatures to become blinded when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.[LONGSTART] Unlike protection from evil, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by evil creatures.[LONGEND]
Second, each warded creature gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} resistance 25 against evil spells and spells cast by evil creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects from attempts to dominate or charm the subject.
Finally, if an evil creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a creature warded by a holy aura, the offending attacker is blinded (Fortitude save negates, as blindness, but against holy aura's save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g}).
28f2f016-8bfb-4125-8a61-0176d60c6884: A creature under the effect of this enchantment enters a state of euphoria. Until the end of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s duration, the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is halved, and it must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} each next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} to avoid being nauseated for 1 round.
6bddab18-3d95-4355-8309-81cf5a6ad57f:
A dim blue glow surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by chaotic creatures, and slowing chaotic creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.[LONGSTART] Unlike protection from chaos, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by chaotic creatures.[LONGEND]
Second, a warded creature gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} resistance 25 against chaotic spells and spells cast by chaotic creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects from all mind-affecting spells and effects.
Finally, if a chaotic creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a warded creature, the attacker is slowed (Will save negates, as the slow spell, but against shield of law's save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g}).
7360d5fb-13c9-4261-bc52-1ace33d329d3:
A malevolent darkness surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by good creatures, and weakening good creatures when they strike the subjects. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.[LONGSTART] Unlike the effect of protection from good, this benefit applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by good creatures.[LONGEND]
Second, warded creatures gain {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} resistance 25 against good spells and spells cast by good creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects from attempts to dominate or charm the subject.
Finally, if a good creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a warded creature, the offending attacker takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (Fortitude negates).
ac79e469-8fb8-4d9f-84f4-e353f650b3cb:
A random pattern of color surrounds the subjects, protecting them from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting them {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resistance to spells{/g} cast by lawful creatures, and causing lawful creatures that strike the subjects to become confused. This abjuration has four effects.
First, each warded creature gains a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.[LONGSTART] Unlike protection from law, the benefit of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} applies against all attacks, not just against attacks by lawful creatures.[LONGEND]
Second, each warded creature gains spell resistance 25 against lawful spells and spells cast by lawful creatures.
Third, the abjuration protects from all mind-affecting spells and effects.
Finally, if a lawful creature succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against a warded creature, the offending attacker is confused for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (Will save negates, as with the confusion spell, but against the save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of cloak of chaos).
bfe36175-fcb0-4cc1-9703-e3ce3b668aa5:
A twisting pattern of coruscating colors weaves through the air, affecting creatures within. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} affects a total number of HD of creatures equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20). Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first, and among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the spell's point of origin are affected first. HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted. The spell affects each subject according to its HD.
6 or less: {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}Unconscious{/g} for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, then stunned for the same amount of rounds, and then confused for the same amount of rounds. (Treat an unconscious result as stunned for nonliving creatures.)
7 to 12: Stunned for 1d4 rounds, then confused for the same amount of rounds.
13 or more: Confused for 1d4 rounds.
Sightless creatures are not affected by scintillating pattern.
c468d1a8-b6da-45ff-a283-6ef42848f168:
Breath Weapon: 100-foot line of acid.
Immunity: acid.
ba0978a7-a350-4760-87be-35dc31da5b02:
Breath Weapon: 100-foot line of electricity.
Immunity: electricity.
11d6564f-fd06-4ff1-97d7-5370457df068:
Breath Weapon: 100-foot line of fire.
Immunity: fire.
a3dbc10d-fa15-426f-bc17-6d288de58e20:
Breath Weapon: 50-foot cone of acid.
Immunity: acid.
a142b9f5-fe87-42ad-bcfb-8f3d4fddda89:
Breath Weapon: 50-foot cone of cold.
Immunity: cold.
b34b19ea-37f5-42e4-9096-d903737982ac:
Breath Weapon: 50-foot cone of fire.
Immunity: fire.
58af3403-70f4-47c3-bf30-2ed3c3bdc5c4:
Chanting an unholy litany, you reach out with a grasping motion toward your target and cause its heart to leap out of its chest and into your hand.
A target with 200 or fewer {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} remaining that fails its {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} is instantly killed.
A target with 201 or more hit points that fails its saving throw manages to keep its heart from leaping out of its chest, but it is still staggered for 1 minute and takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} drain and 1d4 points of Constitution bleed.
Regardless of its current hit points, if the target succeeds at its Fortitude save, it is still staggered for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as it feels its heart wrenching within its chest.
6e0131ca-e652-4923-8a79-7c99f4ad889f:
Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +40) to nearby living enemies.
Like other inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, it cures undead in its area rather than damaging them. A cleric capable of spontaneously casting inflict spells can also spontaneously cast mass inflict spells.
b88d1740-483e-48c2-8ba0-2adf4217eaee:
Sunburst causes a globe of searing radiance to explode silently from a point you select. All creatures in the globe are blinded and take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}6d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} negates the blindness and reduces the damage by half.
An undead creature caught within the globe takes 1d6 points of damage per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 25d6), or half damage with a successful Reflex save.
f7b92b04-6fc6-431e-a1bb-604f9ad090f1: The subject gains a +8 resistance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g} (but not against supernatural and extraordinary abilities).
150ead05-99a4-479f-8c21-f34f7cae2d68: The subject suffers a -12 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score.
54a21324-7d63-4b32-837d-3a9f149e59ee: The subject suffers a -12 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} scores.
d6d118f8-d599-4530-a348-a04f8892a3d0: The subject suffers a -12 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} scores.
f6328dc7-7da1-47c7-b6b8-051963d244e9: The subject suffers a -8 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
dbcc3ccf-d374-4303-80f6-6639f4ae7200: This character has a +8 resistance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}.
27211883-95b9-43ef-84b3-cb5678206420: This creature is in a state of euphoria. Until the end of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}'s duration, the creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is halved, and it must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} to avoid being nauseated for 1 round.
64bb3457-5f7e-4b46-950f-27fa59eac775: This potent {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d6) to living creatures in the area of effect.
2d9844a0-e843-4bff-a144-d81acdcaeb01: This special quality makes a creature's very presence unsettling to foes. Opponents within a range of 30 feet who witness the creature may become frightened or shaken for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}5d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. This ability affects only opponents with fewer {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} than the creature has. An opponent can resist the effects with a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. An opponent that succeeds on their saving throw is immune to that same creature's frightful presence for 24 hours. On a failed save, the opponent is shaken, or frightened if it has 4 Hit Dice or fewer. Frightful presence is a mind-affecting fear effect.
3eb4a524-5d5c-4561-a5fc-ad7379de2b93: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} evaporates moisture from the body of each subject living creature, causing flesh to wither and crack and crumble to dust. This deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d6). This spell is especially devastating to water elementals and plant creatures, which instead take 1d8 points of damage per caster level (maximum 20d8).
30eebb7f-8c2d-4c6b-a5f5-5b319422a648: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as dragonkind II save that it also allows you to take the form of a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}huge{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain the following abilities: a +10 polymorph {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +8 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +8 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, blindsense with a range of 60 feet, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 10/magic, frightful presence ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal to the DC for this spell), and immunity to one element. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g}), two claws (2d6), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d8), and one tail slap attack (2d6). You can use the breath weapon as often as you like, but you must wait 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} between uses. All breath weapons deal 12d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage. Line breath weapons increase to 100-foot lines and cones increase to 50-foot cones.
b962baf9-88c5-4a4f-8f3c-482d8c181dd4:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like shadow evocation, except that it enables you to create a partially real, illusory version of a chain lightning, cold ice strike, ki shout, sirocco, caustic eruption, or elemental assessor spell. If recognized as a greater shadow evocation, a damaging spell deals only three-fifths (60%) {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
Shadow Evocation: You tap energy from the Plane of Shadow to cast a quasi-real, illusory version of a fireball, lightning bolt, shout, volcanic storm, or ice storm spell. Spells that deal damage have normal effects unless an affected creature succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. Each disbelieving creature takes only one-fifth damage from the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. Regardless of the result of the save to disbelieve, an affected creature is also allowed any save (or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}) that the spell being simulated allows, but the save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is set according to shadow evocation's level (5th) rather than the spell's normal level.
f3d63b5c-ee32-480a-99c0-f1e2244ea489: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} grants a +8 resistance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against all mind-affecting spells and effects. The subject is also protected from all items, spells, and other effects that gather information about the target through divination magic (such as thoughtsense, true seeing, and see invisibility).
597dfeca-7b44-4865-bd4a-a865e1365682: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side an elder air elemental. The summoned elemental appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
09d00b65-333c-4e0f-a737-324f20b2f156: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side an elder earth elemental. The summoned elemental appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
31df932d-b279-4c3d-8d4a-e4dc83b3d1c1: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side an elder fire elemental. The summoned elemental appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
5a8c6047-b4e6-4e3c-bbee-e213a7f96ef7: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side an elder fire, water, air, or earth elemental. The summoned elemental appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
df8ac5b0-a181-4dda-8628-83d81ba96e0e: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons to your side an elder water elemental. The summoned elemental appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
8bd69e4a-2cf4-4842-9835-4350ab800b89:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} tears a rift in reality, creating an extradimensional hole with a depth of 60 feet. Since the rift extends into the Abyss, it does not displace the original underlying material or allow access to areas below the surface — you can create the rift on the deck of a ship as easily as in a dungeon floor or the ground of a forest.
Any large or smaller creature standing in the area where you first conjured the rift must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} to jump to safety in the nearest open space. In addition, the edges of the rift are sloped, and any creature ending its turn on a square adjacent to the rift must make a Reflex saving throw with a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to avoid falling into it. Creatures subjected to an effect intended to push them into the rift (such as bull rush) do not get a saving throw to avoid falling in if they are affected by the pushing effect.
The walls of the rift are covered with razor-sharp blades, while the floor seethes with boiling pools of acid, strange chewing vermin, writhing shards of ice, and all manner of other chaotic and deadly manifestations of the Abyss. A creature that falls into the rift takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}6d6{/g} points of falling {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Any creature in the rift (starting on the {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} it enters) takes an additional 6d6 points of damage from the rift's environs, even if the creature is merely climbing or flying within the rift rather than standing at the bottom. This additional damage changes from round to round and is randomly selected from acid, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}bludgeoning{/g}, cold, electricity, fire, piercing, slashing, or sonic. Each round, a creature in the rift can attempt a Reflex save to take half damage that round. To climb the rift's walls, a creature need a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Athletics}Athletics{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 35.
When this spell's duration ends, the rift snaps shut, violently expelling all creatures still within. These creatures take double damage from the rift's environs in that round and are knocked prone as they are returned to the surface above.
8db561de-86d0-483f-b819-37667c2464e2:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} transforms your body into living iron, which grants you several powerful resistances and abilities. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 15/adamantine. You are immune to blindness, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, disease, drowning, electricity, poison, stunning, and all spells or {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} that affect your physiology or respiration, because you have no physiology or respiration while this spell is in effect. You have acid and fire resistance 30.
You gain a +6 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} score, but you take a -6 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} as well (to a minimum Dexterity score of 1), and your {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is reduced to half normal. You have an {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g} of 35% and a -6 {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g}, just as if you were clad in full plate armor.
Your {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attack{/g} deals damage equal to a club sized for you ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} for Small characters or 1d6 for Medium characters), and you are considered armed when making unarmed attacks.
62b0cd39-94fb-4f78-8e19-85fa41f0ae10:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} works as beast shape III, except you change the form of every ally in 10 ft. area into a Large bear.
Beast Shape III: You become a Large bear. You gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also have two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, one 1d6 bite attack, and the rend ability.
Rend: When a bear hits an opponent with both its claws, it deals an additional 1d6 plus 1.5 times its Strength modifier points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}slashing damage{/g}. It can only deal this additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} once each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
3bc42192-c64a-463d-afd7-6e1496531049:
Vines choked with thorns, blossoms, leaflets, and other floral debris burst to life on and around the subject of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
When this spell is cast, the subject becomes paralyzed and entangled, though a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} negates the paralysis. Each following {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the subject may attempt a new saving throw to end both the paralysis and the entangle effects.
The subject takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}piercing damage{/g} each turn from the sharp thorns. This {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} is considered to be cold iron for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}.
31d4c33d-c23f-4d3f-aed2-c7b6dd01a576: When you cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, lightning spills forth from your body in all directions. Enemy creatures within the area take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d8) and are stunned for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} halves the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and negates the stun effect.
d97e49a7-e452-49b6-a368-312acbac5a11: You are in a dragon-like creature form now. You have a +10 polymorph {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +8 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +8 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, blindsense with a range of 60 feet, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 10/magic, frightful presence ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal to the DC for this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}), and immunity to acid. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g}), two claws (2d6), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d8), and one tail slap attack (2d6). You can use the breath weapon as often as you like, but you must wait 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} between uses.
b4b62ae9-bd08-45db-8e9d-47c70ac400b7: You are in a dragon-like creature form now. You have a +10 polymorph {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +8 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +8 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, blindsense with a range of 60 feet, a breath weapon, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} 10/magic, frightful presence ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} equal to the DC for this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}), and immunity to cold. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g}), two claws (2d6), two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d8), and one tail slap attack (2d6). You can use the breath weapon as often as you like, but you must wait 1d4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} between uses.
3a79112b-697a-49c6-b01f-a559a33a81b5: You are in a dragon-like creature form now. a5465876-50d3-4688-9920-7347291272ee: You become a larger, awful version of yourself and take on features that horrify your enemies. You also emit an aura that emanates 30 feet from you. Enemy creatures within the aura are shaken. Each time a creature shaken by this aura hits you with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, that creature becomes frightened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}, though at the end of that duration it is no longer affected by this aura. The aura's effect is a fear and mind-affecting effect.
5b567989-f127-4dae-81b4-032681c06910: You can't use your breath weapon right now.
c95a742a-1aac-44a3-a415-a59874b268f9:
You place a curse on the subject. Choose one of the following:
Greater Curse of Feeble Body — The subject suffers a -12 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score.
Greater Curse of Weakness — The subject suffers a -12 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} scores.
Greater Curse of Idiocy — The subject suffers a -12 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} scores.
Greater Curse of Deterioration — The subject suffers a -8 penalty on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}.
2ae836af-b301-4cd7-8976-2fd1d4da0b5f: You sheathe yourself within a churning column of pure elemental water up to 30 feet high that fills your space. You can see, hear, and breathe normally within the seamantle, but {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} against you are treated as if you were under the surface of the water. You gain improved cover (+8 cover {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, +4 bonus on Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}) against foes that do not have freedom of movement effects. You also gain immunity to fire. The cover granted by the seamantle does not enable you to make {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth checks{/g} or prevent {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. Magical attacks against you are unaffected unless they require attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}.
1a0e3a71-c9cf-4788-9707-96bea8745251: You utter a single word of power that instantly causes one creature of your choice to become stunned, whether the creature can hear the word or not. The duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} depends on the target's current hit point total. Any creature that currently has 151 or more {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} is unaffected by power word stun. For 50 or less HP, the duration is {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}; for 51–100 HP, the duration is 2d4 rounds; for 101–150 HP, the duration is 1d4 rounds.
dca2571d-8cd4-4eee-ae93-b6e0aacb87f8: You wrack the target's body and mind with the anguish and suffering of every bitter failure it will ever {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, rendering it permanently shaken and sickened. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces the duration to 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per level.
